original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields up at close
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields were up at close on Tuesday, dealers said while the interbank guidance peg by the Central Bank appreciated.
A bond maturing on 01.02.2025 closed at 32.10/25 percent on Tuesday, up from 32.00/20 percent on Monday.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 closed at 29.50/70 percent, up from yesterday’s close at 29.25/50 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.001.2028 closed at 28.00/30, up from yesterday’s close at 27.30/28.30 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 29.10/30, down from yesterday’s close at 29.20/30 percent.
The Central Bank’s guidance peg for interbank US dollar transactions appreciated by 87 cents to 361.63 rupees from 362.50 against the US dollar. (Colombo/Feb 28/2023)
